datafield.subfield: Shīrāzī, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr,
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 639
Origin: As appears in colophon on p.95, copied by ʻAlī ibn Chak al-Sachdī [?] (Ali b. Çek es-Seçti) with transcription completed 957 [1550 or 51].
Accompanying materials: Acquisitions slip from Yahuda.
Former shelfmark: From interior of upper cover and label on lower cover "IL 390" (likely supplied by Yahuda, see acquisitions slip).

Binding: Pasteboards covered in marbled paper (mainly in blue, yellow and red) with brown leather over spine, fore edge flap, and edges/turn-ins (framed binding) ; Type II binding (with flap) ; board linings in olive green paper ; sewn in blue thread, two stations ; overall in fair condition with some abrasion, staining, lifting and losses of leather at board edges and fore edge flap, etc.

Support: non-European laid paper with 4-5 laid lines per cm. (vertical) and single chain lines (horizontal) spaced around 90 mm. apart ; quite cloudy formation, sturdy and well-burnished ; some staining and tide lines ; some repairs.
Decoration: Keywords, abbreviations (sigla), and vocalization (for the verses being commented upon) rubricated.

Script: Naskh ; compact Caucasian (Azeri) [?] hand ; virtually serifless with slight effect of tilt to left and of words descending to baseline, mainly closed counters, pointing in distinct dots, descenders mainly curvilinear.
Layout: Written in 23 lines per page.
Collation: VI-1 (7), 2 IV(23), I (25), 2 IV(41), III+1 (48) ; chiefly quaternions ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization.

Colophon: "Scribal," triangular, reads "وقع الفراغ من تنميق هذه النسخة الشريفة المباركة المسماة بنزهة الطالبين يوم الثلاث [؟] وقت الظهر على يدي اضعف العباد واحقرهم عملا واكبرهم ذنبا واحوجهم الى غفران الله على بن چك السچدى في سنه سبع وخمسين وتسعمائة من هجرة النبي صلى الله [عليه وسلم] "
Explicit: "وبالنغم متعلق به والباء للاستعانة بلفظ الاستعانة ختم كتابنا ونستعين بالله على ان يختم اعمالنا بما نرجو به سعادة ما لنا وهو نعم النصير على امالنا"

Incipit: "الحمد لله نحمده ونستعينه ونعوذ بك من شرور انفسنا ومن سيئات اعمالنا ... فيقول احقر العباد وافقرهم المستعيذ بالله من عقابه الاليم احمد بن محمد بن ابي بكر غفر الله لهم ... رويت القصيدة المباركة الموسومة بالكواكب الدرية المسماة بالبردة النبوية المنسوبة الى الامام العلامة ابي عبد الله محمد بن سعيد الدلاصي البوصيري عن الشيخ ..."
Title from inscription on 'title page' (p.1) and colophon on p.95.

Careful copy of the commentary by Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Shīrāzī (fl.1407) on al-Būṣīrī's (d.1296?) celebrated poem in praise of the Prophet, al-Kawākib al-durrīyah fī madḥ khayr al-barīyah, widely known as al-Burdah.
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Traces of effaced former owners' marks on upper board lining and 'title page' (p.1), including several statements and two oval seal impressions ; on verso of final leaf (p.96), waqf statement in name of Maḥmūd al-Daghastānī ( محمود الدغستاني ) son of al-Shaykh Saʻīd ibn al-Mullā ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Mullā ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Daghastānī ( الشيخ سعيد بن الملا عبد الرحيم بن الملا عبد الكريم الدغستاني ), endowed to al-Sayyid Qāsim ibn al-Sayyid ʻAlī Daqqāq al-Dūdah [al-Dawdah ?] ( السيد قاسم بن السيد علي دقاق الدوده ) and his offspring after him and then to students, wittnessed by al-Sayyid Amīn al-Khayyāṭ ( السيد امين الخياط ) ; marginal corrections.
Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd,
شيرازي، احمد بن محمد بن ابي بكر.
